keyTakeAways: Poland has arrested eight individuals suspected of espionage and sabotage, including three Ukrainian nationals, who allegedly planned to transport explosives from Poland and Romania to Ukraine.
The arrests are part of a broader pattern of Russian hybrid warfare, involving espionage, sabotage, and drone attacks, targeting European countries that support Ukraine.
Poland has arrested 55 people over the past three years for suspected sabotage and espionage, with charges under Article 130 of the penal code.
Romania’s intelligence agency reported that two Ukrainian citizens were coordinated by Russian secret services and left explosive packages at a delivery company.
The United Kingdom and other EU nations have accused Russia of orchestrating sabotage operations, with Russia denying the allegations as 'Russophobia'.
Drone incursions by Russia have increased across Western Europe, prompting NATO to upgrade air defenses and the EU to propose a 'drone wall' along eastern borders.
Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk has called for urgent upgrades to Poland’s air defenses following drone attacks, reflecting growing security concerns.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Poland has arrested eight individuals, including three Ukrainian nationals, on suspicion of espionage and sabotage, with allegations of planning to send explosive packages across Poland and Romania to Ukraine. These arrests are part of a broader pattern of Russian hybrid warfare, including drone incursions and cross-border sabotage, targeting European nations supporting Ukraine. Polish and Romanian authorities report coordination between suspects and Russian intelligence services, with evidence of explosive packages left at delivery companies. The incident follows a growing number of similar cases in the UK, Lithuania, and Latvia, and reflects broader European concerns over hybrid threats. In response, Poland has upgraded its air defenses, and the EU has proposed a 'drone wall' to defend against drone incursions, signaling a coordinated regional response to escalating security threats.
title: Poland arrests suspected saboteurs amid fears of Russian ‘hybrid warfare’
